title: WCAS ART 390-0-25 Special Topics in Art
topic: Weapons of the Weak: Image-making as Resistance

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
This course borrows its title from the text by James C. Scott that explores forms of daily resistance against authority in agrarian societies. Together, we will examine how weakness and power are constructed and the potential roles of creative production in complicating those hierarchies. Performance techniques of Image and Forum Theater will serve as frequent departure points for personal and collective exploration. Image-making and time-based practices are highly encouraged and students will have access to the digital lab and printing facilities, though interdisciplinary and cross-disciplinary practices are welcome.

Readings include texts from Kimberlé Crenshaw, Paolo Freire, Hito Steyerl, Gloria Anzaldua, Mimi Thi Nguyen, James C. Scott, and Sylvia Federici among others. Artists discussed will include: Walid Raad, Simone Leigh, Emily Jacir, Theresa Hak Kyung Cha, Erica Lord, Coco Fusco, Danh Vo, and Trinh T. Minh-Ha amongst others.
